title: DUAL LEGEND
summary: A two-way comet who owned the tournament spotlight.
story: {player_last} finished as one of the rare two-way heroes of Koshien.
He posted an ERA of {era_text} over {innings_text} innings while launching {hr_text} home runs.
That balance carried {school_name} to {titles_text} championship banner(s) and a place in tournament folklore.

title: IRONCLAD ACE
summary: A prestige program's trusted big-game starter.
story: Every elimination game seemed to end with {player_last} on the mound, carving lineups with surgical poise.
His career ERA settled at {era_text}, matching the reputation of {school_name}'s powerhouse program.
Scouts wrote that his next chapter would start in the draft room, not in an office.

title: LIGHT-TOWER BAT
summary: Middle-of-the-order thunder that never cooled off.
story: Pitchers whispered whenever {player_last} stepped to the plate.
{player_first} slugged {hr_text} homers with a {avg_text} average, forcing opposing coaches to rewrite every scouting report.
College recruiters lined up even before the season ended.

title: GENERATIONAL ACE
story: After graduating from {school_name}, {player_last} was selected in the first round of the NPB Draft.
He dominated the Japanese league for 5 years, winning the Sawamura Award three times.
At age 24, he signed a massive contract with an MLB team.
He played 12 seasons in the majors, winning 3 World Series titles and an MVP award.
Baseball historians now regard him as the greatest Japanese export in history...
{color_gold}With the sole exception of Shohei Ohtani, of course.{color_reset}

title: TRAGIC HERO
summary: A star that burned too bright, too fast.
story: {player_last} was undeniable when healthy. He led {school_name} to glory while pitching through pain.
But the cost was high. His shoulder was a ticking time bomb.
He was drafted in the second round, but his pro career was a series of surgeries and rehab.
Fans still argue he had the highest ceiling of his generation, if only his body held up.
He retired at 25, a legend of Koshien, but a 'what if' of the pros.

title: RETIRED (INJURY)
story: Injuries robbed {player_last} of his high school career.
He spent more time in the trainer's room than on the field.
Scouts saw the potential, but the medical reports were too risky.
He went undrafted and quietly hung up his cleats.
Sometimes he watches games and wonders how good he could have been.

title: RETIRED (NO KOSHIEN)
summary: The summer ended at the district stadium.
story: For three years, {player_last} chased the dream of the Sacred Stadium.
But the wall of the district qualifiers was too high.
He graduated without ever stepping foot on Koshien soil.
He played recreationally in college, but the regret of that final summer loss never fully faded.
He is now a salaryman who avidly watches the tournament every August.

title: DRAFTED (HIGH)
story: {player_last} was a furnace on the mound — drafted into the NPB and unleashed as a strikeout ace.
Long seasons, multiple awards, and a lasting legacy followed.

title: DRAFTED (STARTER)
story: {player_last} heard his name on draft night and grew into a reliable rotation anchor.
Not always flashy, but the clubhouse swore by him.

title: DRAFTED (CATCHER)
story: Teams coveted {player_last}'s defense and leadership.
He guided pitching staffs like a veteran from day one and became a coach-in-waiting.

title: DRAFTED PRO
summary: The start of a long professional career.
story: {player_last} made the jump to professional baseball.
A long career was ahead: not always a superstar, but a respected name everyone trusted.

title: CAPTAIN OF THE DYNASTY
summary: Led a blue-blood program to silverware.
story: {school_name} expects banners, and {player_last} delivered exactly that.
Whether it was a timely hit or a diving stop, the captain supplied whatever the moment demanded.
He graduates as the face of a program that measures seasons in trophies.

title: LIMITLESS HYBRID
summary: A raw two-way talent scouts want to polish.
story: {player_last} never quite won it all, but every region remembered the kid who refused to pick a lane.
He logged {innings_text} innings with a {era_text} ERA and still muscled {hr_text} balls over the fence.
Player development directors circled his name as their favorite project.

title: TWO-WAY PHENOM
story: {player_last} surprised everyone by dominating on the mound and in the heart of the order.
He split time between roles, produced highlight reels, and convinced pro scouts he could do both.

title: WORKHORSE STARTER
summary: Durable, fearless, and beloved by teammates.
story: No rainout, no doubleheader, no extra innings scared {player_last}.
He logged {innings_text} varsity innings with a {era_text} ERA and the kind of grit every coach trusts.
Corporate and university teams have already offered him a locker.

title: ELITE CLOSER
story: {player_last} found his calling as a late-inning power arm.
A smaller frame but electric heat, he slammed the door whenever the anthem faded.

title: CRAFTY ACE
story: {player_last} owed his success to guile and command.
Rather than blow hitters away, he outsmarted them into weak swings.
A long pro career as a crafty starter followed.

title: LATE BLOOMER
story: {player_last}'s development arc was cinematic — from anonymous freshman to pro-caliber ace by senior summer.

title: FOLK HERO ACE
summary: Beloved by fans despite physical limits.
story: {player_last} pitched through pain for {school_name} and earned a prefecture's admiration.

title: FUTURE MANAGER
summary: A catcher who becomes the dugout's brain.
story: {player_last}'s mind for the game was unrivaled.
After a modest pro run he transitioned seamlessly into coaching, then managing, shaping future generations.

title: GOLD GLOVE CATCHER
story: {player_last} commanded the diamond as a defensive rock.
Pro teams prized his framing and game-calling; he enjoyed a long career behind the plate.

title: POWER CATCHER

title: COACH / MENTOR
story: {player_last} never made the big lights as a pro, but his knowledge turned him into an exceptional college coach.

title: CATCHING CAREER
story: {player_last} enjoyed a fulfilling baseball life — some pro seasons, some coaching, lots of respect.
Catchers like him keep the sport healthy.

title: GOLD GLOVE INFIELDER
story: {player_last} patrolled the infield like a vacuum.
Professional teams loved his glove work; awards and highlight reels followed.

title: CLEANUP CORNER
story: {player_last} terrorized pitching from the hot corner.

title: CLUTCH SHORTSTOP
story: {player_last} anchored the defense and led the team with clutch plays.

title: UNIVERSITY CATCHER

story: {player_last} used university ball to improve and later play professionally.

title: TWO-WAY LEGACY

title: DISTRICT FOLK HERO

story: Every small-town broadcast mentioned {player_last}'s moonshots.
He cranked {hr_text} homers despite facing ace-level pitching every week.

title: BASEBALL FOR LIFE
summary: Keeps playing, coaching, and giving back.
story: {player_last} went on to play baseball at a competitive adult level.

title: UNIVERSITY PATH
story: {player_last} walked into university ball and worked extremely hard.

title: WORK & BASEBALL
summary: A balanced life with baseball on the side.

title: RETIRED
story: With the final out of summer, {player_last} left his glove on the field.
He went on to university, studied economics, and became a salaryman.
Sometimes, when drinking with colleagues, he talks about that one hot summer when he chased a dream at Koshien.
